results.title: Cosi Fan Tutte
results.brief_description: The Swedish conductor Arnold Ostman collaborates with German producer Willy Decker on this ever popular Mozart comedy with an extensively rehearsed cast of young Swedish singers. The setting is the immaculately restored 18th century Drottningholm Court Theatre at the country residence of the Swedish Royal Family.

results.title: Cosi
results.creator_credit: Smiley Film, Meridian Films, Richard Brennan, Timothy White and Mark Joffe
results.brief_description: Lewis (Ben Mendelsohn) is a uni drop-out who takes a last-ditch job in an asylum working with patients who are interested in the dramatic arts. He thinks his work will involve staging a small variety show with the group, until long-term patient, Roy, insists that the production be nothing less than a grand staging of Mozart’s opera Cosi Fan Tutte. It’s an ambitious thought to say the least. After all, none of the patients can speak Italian nor sing and the cast is made up of aging nymphomaniacs, obsessives and pyromaniacs who really have other things on their minds. Funny, warm and wonderfully mad, this is one production that’s definitely all there, even if the cast isn’t.

results.title: Cortege of Eagles (TEFC)
results.brief_description: One of a group of modern dances created by Martha Graham. A creative ballet representing her mature creative work. The story is set in Ancient Troy at the time of its fall. When Hecuba, portrayed by Martha Graham, is faced with the inevitable consequence of the violent times, she herself is driven to terrible violence. Music composed and conducted by Eugene Lester: setting by Isamu Noguchi.

results.title: Correspondences: Víctor Erice and Abbas Kiarostami [exhibition]: archival material
results.brief_description:
“Correspondences” was an ACMI Screen Gallery Exhibition, held 21 August 2008 - 2 November 2008.

See Exhibition activity record “Correspondences” (ID 35 ) for more information

Spanish director Víctor Erice’s small but acclaimed body of work has been widely acknowledged for its poetic and masterful storytelling. Iranian filmmaker Abbas Kiarostami is regarded as a master of contemporary world cinema, voted by many critics as the most important director of the nineties.

Although these two great filmmakers met face-to-face only once before this exhibition, they discovered powerful parallels in their interests and ideas. Featuring film, photography and new work created especially for the exhibition, Correspondences represents the long distance creative dialogue and intimate rapport that developed between Erice and Kiarostami.

results.title: Correlieu (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Louis Portugais and Jean Palardy
results.brief_description: The life and philosophy of the Quebec painter, Ozias Leduc, traced through his own paintings and scenes of his home, “Correlieu”, and the surrounding countryside. His technique and its influence on other painters is demonstrated, and his consciousness of the turbulent modern schools that came and went during his long lifetime is revealed. Included are some of the large paintings he did for cathedrals and churches. Narrated by George Whalley.

results.title: Correction procedures
results.brief_description: Demonstrates and provides correction techniques used when assessing written work to provide immediate feedback on children’s progress. Shows how to diagnose incorrect responses by response type, how to recognize the type of error and three basic correction procedures.
results.description: Demonstrates and provides correction techniques used when assessing written work to provide immediate feedback on children’s progress. Shows how to diagnose incorrect responses by response type, how to recognize the type of error and three basic correction procedures.

results.title: Corral
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Tom Daly and Colin Low
results.brief_description: The roping and riding of a high-spirited half-broken horse is the subject of a film which makes visual poetry of this theme. Movement and music combine to tel a story without words, set in the foothills of Alberta, as we watch a cowboy perform a task which is part of a centuries-old tradition of the West. The music, played on guitar, is an original score containing variations on Western Ballad. (Five awards, including Venice; Edinburgh)

results.title: Corps flottant
results.brief_description: Cahen’s film is a video essay of a transitory reality depicted through the rhythms of rural life in Japan. Men bathe in the thermal springs of Kusatu, while an elderly woman tends to a rice paddy. Cahen creates a dream-like chronicle of the landscape and develops a painterly impression of the figures who exist within that landscape.

results.title: Corps a Coeur = Body to Heart
results.brief_description:
Pierre is a garage mechanic in his mid-30s with a considerable taste for the ladies. It comes as something of a surprise when he falls passionately in love with Jeanne, a woman in her 50s. She is unmoved by his advances, and despite her sharp rebuffs, he persists. Her heart thaws when she learns she is suffering from an incurable and fatal disease.

Credits: Producer, Cecile Clairval ; director, Paul Vecchiali ; writer, Paul Vecchiali ; photography, Georges Strouve ; music, Gabriel Faure, Roland Vincent.
Cast: Nicolas Silberg, Helene Surgere, Christine Murillo, Madeleine Robinson, Myriam Mezieres.
